intro: Cheilanthes feei, commonly known as the Fee's rockcap, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is a small, terrestrial fern that typically grows on rocky outcrops and in shaded, humid environments. The plant has a short, creeping rhizome with tightly clustered, ovate to elliptic fronds that are dark green and leathery in texture. Its spores are produced in clusters on the underside of the fronds, and it is often found in limestone or sandy soils. Cheilanthes feei is a hardy plant that is adapted to survive in arid and semi-arid conditions.
